column2: Evaluates and assesses nutrition status of patients, and screens patients for nutritional risk in accordance with established department protocols and standards. column2: To Performs duties as scrub nurse      Checks and prepares instrument trolley for surgical cases.      Checks instrument and carry out instrument and swab counts according to standard procedure.      Checks and identifies the correct patient for the correct surgery, taking special note of the consent, site of operation, allergy etc.      Ensures patients safety at all times.      Supervises and checks to ensure accurate recording of all chargeable consumable items and supplies used by patients.      To ensure correct swabs, needles and instrument counts according to standard practice and reports any discrepancy in any of the counts to nurse manager.      To ensure accurate labeling and specimens are properly dispatched      To ensure all TOP and sterilisation cases are properly recorded and documented.      Ensure all TOP cases done by authorized gynecologists and all guidelines must be met.      To perform duties as circulating nurse.      To guide and supervises the duties of the Enrolled Nurses and Healthcare Assistants.      To perform duties as assistance to the surgeons.      To take care of the post-operation patients in the recovery phase.      To assist in the cleaning, packing and sterilisation of instrument and surgical supplies according to Central Sterile Supply Department (CSSD) standards.      To ensure total cleanliness of the operating theatres and preparation rooms      Supervises the decontamination of operating theatre, equipment, and instrument following each contaminated case.      To check crash cart, emergency equipment and supplies daily.

column1: Hiring For Clinical Reviewer (Nursing candidates Only)
column2: Dear Aspirant!!!...     Hiring for Clinical Reviewer     Role & responsibilities Review medical records and follow stringent protocols to determine whether patients meet the standards for insurance reimbursement. Clinical review for medical necessity of identified claims. Documentation of clinical rationale supporting findings of the review. Apply clinical judgment, honed over years in acute care settings, to make responsible decisions that promote appropriate records review and applications usage while keeping resources available to those most in need. Review and validate all information pertaining to the claim. Comply with procedures, regulations, and rules in maintaining medical records. Interacts on a continuous basis with other departments by directing activities towards positive outcomes     Preferred candidate profile Any Nursing Graduates and 10+2+3 (BSc GNM Nursing/ GNM Nursing/Post BSc/MSc Nursing)     Minimum 0 to 3 years of clinical experience in ISO, NABH, JCI hospitals (Not Mandatory)     Must be willing to work in US shift. Must be willing to work from Office. MS office Typing skills, computer skills Good communication in English Good analytical skills     Perks and benefits Both Ways transportation will be provided.     Location  - Bangalore Working Hours/ Days -  9 Hours / 5 Days a Week.     Shift Timings : U.S Shift (4:30 Pm to 1:30 AM )   Only Immediate joiners are preferred.     Contact person: Pooja Chavan: 8928134219 / 9664530023 Interested candidates can share your resume to pooja.chavan@sagilityhealth.com  and refer your friends for an interview

column2: Apollo Tele health Services is looking for  ANM - Medical Services - UPTMto join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     An Auxiliary Nurse Midwife (ANM) is a healthcare professional responsible for delivering primary healthcare services, with a focus on maternal and child health     The ANM works closely with registered nurses, doctors, and other healthcare professionals to ensure the well-being of individuals and communities     The role involves providing healthcare services, promoting health education, and participating in community health programs         Key Responsibilities:         Maternal and Child Health Services:Provide antenatal and postnatal care to pregnant women     Assist in safe delivery and postpartum care     Conduct immunization programs for infants and children     Monitor the growth and development of children     Family Planning and Reproductive Health:Educate individuals and couples on family planning methods     Distribute contraceptives and provide counseling on family planning     Community Health Services:Conduct health surveys and assessments in the community     Implement health promotion and disease prevention programs     Organize health camps and awareness sessions     Primary Healthcare Services:Provide basic medical care and first aid     Administer vaccinations and medications as prescribed     Monitor and manage communicable diseases     Health Education:Conduct health education sessions for individuals and communities     Raise awareness about hygiene, nutrition, and preventive healthcare measures     Promote healthy lifestyle choices     Record Keeping:Maintain accurate and updated patient records     Compile statistical data on healthcare services provided     Prepare reports for supervisory and administrative purposes     Collaboration and Communication:Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, including doctors and nurses     Communicate effectively with patients and their families     Coordinate with community leaders and volunteers

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd  is looking for Ctvs Nurse  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Patient Care:          Provide direct and individualized nursing care to patients undergoing cardiothoracic and vascular surgeries.      Prepare patients for surgery by conducting preoperative assessments, verifying medical histories, and obtaining informed consent.      Monitor and document patients' conditions during and after surgery, ensuring timely intervention when necessary.      Administer medications, fluids, and blood products as prescribed by the physician.              Intraoperative Support:          Assist the surgical team during procedures, including preparing and handling instruments, supplies, and equipment.      Maintain a sterile environment in the operating room and ensure adherence to infection control protocols.      Monitor patients' vital signs and respond to any changes during surgery.              Postoperative Care:          Provide intensive postoperative care to patients, including pain management, wound care, and monitoring for complications.      Educate patients and their families on postoperative care and recovery processes.      Coordinate discharge planning and follow-up care with the healthcare team.              Collaboration:          Collaborate with surgeons, anesthesiologists, and other healthcare professionals to develop and implement patient care plans.      Participate in interdisciplinary rounds and contribute to patient care discussions.              Documentation and Compliance:          Maintain accurate and detailed patient records and ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and standards.      Follow hospital policies and procedures, and adhere to the highest standards of nursing practice.

column2: Position: Medical Coder Ct:    HR Shanmugapriya - 9566157627 Medical Coding is the process of converting patient health information into alpha numeric codes. Coders take medial reports from doctors, which may include a patients condition, the doctors diagnosis, a prescription, and whatever procedures the doctor or healthcare provider performed on the patient, and turn that into a set of codes, which make up a crucial part of the medical claim. column2: JOB DESCRIPTION ProfileJob Title Staff Nurse Department Nursing Location / Unit Sarvodaya Hospital, Sector-8, Faridabad Position Reports to Nursing Incharge Key Relationship All doctors, All nurses, All paramedical staff, Guest Relations and all HODs. Main Objective of the Role To assist in delivering high quality nursing care in the hospital. Key Responsibilities   Nursing Knowledge &   Adaptability Awareness  of the departmental vision, mission, objectives and its Implementations. Performs the duties as per the role and expectation of a nurse in providing comprehensive patient care. Knowledge about the layout of the unit, number of patients and types of patient and their requirements. Interaction, co-operation and team spirit with other staff members. Performs assigned duties as per the departments protocol Maintains all registers used in the unit. Accurate knowledge about the forms and formats Performs all special assignments as rostered.   Soft skill and Critical   thinking Demonstrates knowledge on AIDET (Acknowledge, Introduce, Duration, Explanation, Thank) and GST (Greet, smile, thank). Utilizes effective communication skills in reporting pertinent information on time. Maintains telephone etiquettes Maintains professional decorum and communicates in English/Hindi in the areas of work with colleagues. Address to the grooming standards laid down by the department Evaluates effectiveness of nursing care on patient condition Inform Team leader/Supervisor of current activities on the unit and reports unusual occurrence, incidents or other problems and also follow up as needed Utilizes changes of shift report to accurately and effectively to communicate patient condition and intervention Ensure all documentation is clear concise and timely. Utilize appropriate clinical terminology Performs independent problem solving and decision making in a logical and deliberate manner, utilizing available resources when needed Exhibits flexibility and adaptability to meet the needs of the patient and the unit Demonstrates understanding of emergency levels and effectively and safely responds to emergency situation in a calm constructive positive manner.   Nursing Admission   Assessment Performs comprehensive nursing assessment on all patients with consideration to clinical condition, pain activities of daily living, skin allergies, integrity, valuables, safety needs, age, mental, social and physical status. Identifies patient problems based upon data collected through nursing assessment as well as integrated information obtained through the family. Takes measures to address any vital concerns compromising the hemodynamic stability and safety issues Follows all aspects of the hospital policy in terms of safety, personal belongings, medico  legal entity, medications etc. Assesses vital signs, important information and reports abnormalities to the consultant and team and carries out orders as per instructions. Accurately and thoroughly documents nursing assessment and patient problems using appropriate clinical terminology. Completes and documents ongoing assessment Assesses and communicates educational, spiritual, pain management and dietary needs to the concerned Involves, communicates and educates the family members in the future plan of care   Plan of Care Formulates nursing care plan in context to care due, care given, safety first, PFE, diet and other needs in each shift noting patients needs, age, behavior and concerns identified through nursing assessment. Ensures that care is provided with a comprehensive approach always ensuring safety and clinical outcomes. Establishes priorities for nursing needs based on nursing assessment, problems identified and estimated length of stay. Actively participates in the development of interdisciplinary plan of care as per policy Ensures unmet needs are handed over to the next shift accurately Acts as liaison with the treatment team and other multidisciplinary staff ensuring accurate communications of relevant information Ensures evidence through accurate documentation.   Provision of Nursing   Care Practices within the general policies, philosophy and objectives of the department of nursing and the hospital with focus on safety, quality, infection control and empathy. Provides nursing care in a therapeutically efficient manner demonstrating social, clinical and professional judgment and competency. Participates in the implementation of the treatment plan utilizing intervention appropriate to the needs of the patient. Demonstrates knowledge and skills related to special treatment, procedures, precautions, seclusions, restraints etc. Provides supportive counseling of current patient concerns. Assesses unit milieu and maintains a safe, therapeutic environment for patients, family members and staff. Assesses and meets activities of daily living needs of patients in dressing, bathing, grooming, toileting, eating and sleeping. Identifies all vulnerable patients and ensures that the safety first program is followed at all times Demonstrates ability to recognize different types of incidents and responding mechanism for such issues. Accurately and thoroughly documents nursing interventions. Provides ongoing patient / family education according to individual needs, considers factors influencing learning and documents same in the patients medical record Safely uses and maintains biomedical equipments. Updates and keeps abreast of the HAI statistics and control measures and practices them in the working environment. Actively participates in discharge planning, education and care at home along with patient and the family.   Medication Management Is knowledgeable about the medication process and ADR Accurately transcribes medication and treatment orders for the indenting process Recognizes improper or inadequate orders and reports these to supervisors and physician before proceeding Checks and receives medication against the order during pharmacy delivery. Accurately and safely administers prescribed medications and treatments using correct methods of administration and adheres to policy (6 Rs of medication, 2 identifiers, allergic history, double check for applicable medicines), admixtures, outside medication, self-medication policy etc..) Accurately maintains medications administration record Monitors the patient post administration and reports any adverse events and accurately completes the ADR forms Demonstrates safe storage and control of medication. Evaluates and documents patient response to medication regimen Implements the waste management policy Is knowledgeable of action, side effects proper dosage and contraindication of drugs being administered Demonstrates knowledge of and documentation requirements for proper administration of medication to protesting patients. Accurately identifies need to administer SOS medication and documents effect. Immediately reports any medication error, ADRs and accurately completes incidents report or ADR forms. Teaches medication management to patients as per discharge planning requirement   Major Job Qualifications / Specific SkillsRequired Education: GNM/ B.Sc.(Nursing) Experience: 5-9 years+ of post-qualification experience. English & Hindi  Required  Interested candidate can share their CVs on recruitment@sarvodayahospital.com, tannu.dheer@sarvodayahospital.com and can reach on 8929963378/9810094625

column2: Kongunad Hospitals is looking for CTVS OT Scrub Nurse to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     B.SC NURSING STAFF NURSE PREFERRED            Preoperative Preparation    : Prepare the operating room (OR) environment, equipment, and surgical instruments for cardiovascular and thoracic surgeries. Ensure that all necessary supplies and medications are available and properly sterilized.            Assisting Surgeons    : Assist the surgical team, including cardiovascular surgeons, thoracic surgeons, anesthesiologists, and surgical technicians, during surgical procedures. Hand instruments to surgeons, anticipate their needs, and maintain a sterile field throughout the surgery.            Patient Care and Monitoring    : Provide direct patient care before, during, and after surgery. Monitor patients' vital signs, oxygenation, and hemodynamic status closely, and report any abnormalities or changes to the surgical team.            Instrumentation and Equipment Management    : Handle and organize surgical instruments, equipment, and supplies required for cardiovascular and thoracic surgeries. Ensure that instruments are properly sterilized, maintained, and readily accessible during procedures.            Medication Administration    : Administer medications, intravenous fluids, and blood products as prescribed by the surgical team. Monitor patients' responses to medications and intervene promptly to address adverse reactions or complications.            Intraoperative Documentation    : Document intraoperative events, procedures, and medications administered accurately and in real-time. Maintain comprehensive and accurate records of surgical counts, specimens, and other relevant information as per hospital protocols and regulatory requirements.            Team Collaboration    : Collaborate effectively with members of the surgical team, including surgeons, anesthesiologists, perfusionists, surgical assistants, and other healthcare professionals. Communicate clearly and proactively to ensure smooth coordination and patient safety during surgeries.            Emergency Response    : Be prepared to respond to emergencies and unexpected complications during surgeries, such as cardiac arrest, hemorrhage, or airway obstruction. Follow established protocols and procedures for managing critical situations and providing advanced life support measures as needed.
